section.name: Design a simple UML model
section.p: Let's create 3 simple classes. I'll generate the code in Java language as it is the one I know best :

section.name: Create one java template
section.p: Now, let's code your first template, made of 2 files :

p.source:
package ${c.getFullNamespace(".")}; /** * This class was generated automatically thanks to any
*/ public class ${c.name} { <#list c.attributes as anAttribute> <@java.attribute anAttribute/> </#list>
<#list c.attributes as anAttribute> <@java.getter anAttribute/> </#list>
<#list c.attributes as anAttribute> <@java.setter anAttribute/> </#list> }

section.p: You may have noticed @java keyword. This is a built-in directive . Because Astah API can sometimes be difficult to use, boilerplate code is added to directives so that you only have to focus on your custom code generation.
